glsa.title: KDE: Local Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: KDE is vulnerable to a local Denial of Service attack.

background.p: KDE is a feature-rich graphical desktop environment for Linux and Unix-like Operating Systems. DCOP is KDE's simple IPC/RPC mechanism.

description.p: Sebastian Krahmer discovered that it is possible to stall the dcopserver of other users.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit this to cause a local Denial of Service by stalling the dcopserver in the authentication process. As a result all desktop functionality relying on DCOP will cease to function.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
